definition: same as 一樣|一样[yi1 yang4]/the same
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
individual/this/that/size/classifier for people or objects in general
to change from day to day

sentences.english: Discuss a sample healthcare solution and its components.
sentences.chinese: 讨论一个样例医疗解决方案及其组件。

sentences.english: A: I really think all Americans look alike.
sentences.chinese: 我真的觉得美国人长得都一个样。

sentences.english: Now we integrate all of the subfunctions described above into one sample.
sentences.chinese: 现在将把上面所述的所有子函数集成到一个样例中。

sentences.english: Men are all alike in their promises , it is only in their deeds that they differ.
sentences.chinese: 男人们承诺起来都一个样，只有实践起来才显不同。

sentences.english: The shape of clouds is also a kind of moment.
sentences.chinese: 云霞的形状也一会儿一个样。

sentences.english: All those Ivy League bastards look alike.
sentences.chinese: 那些常春藤盟校的混蛋都长一个样。

sentences.english: In the dream you are like this clear, looks like you to give my photograph type.
sentences.chinese: 梦中你是如此的清晰，就象你给我的相片一个样。

sentences.english: Picasso's art was as populated with animals and birds as his life.
sentences.chinese: 毕加索的画和他的生活一个样，满是四足动物和鸟儿。

definition: dialectal equivalent of 怎麼|怎么[zen3 me5]
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
to fool around/to mess with/to do sth without a plan
two quite different things/another kettle of fish
